intro: Polycarpaea corymbosa var. pseudolinearifolia, commonly known as the linear-leaved polycarpaea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves that are often arranged in whorls along the stems. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. This variant is noted for its distinct leaf morphology, which differentiates it from other varieties within the species.
